Package me.fonts.src

Class FontOutput

java.lang.Object
me.fonts.src.FontOutput
public final class FontOutput extends Object
A class dedicated to the aftermath of rendering a font.
Author:
Joshua Diemer

  • Method Details

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(FontFormat format, int x, int y)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      Parameters:
      format - The format to form the text and colors.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(String text, int x, int y, int... colors)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      In order to create a new line, use \n.
      In order to create a tabbed space, use \t.
      In order to create a short space (half the size of a normal NBSP), use \r.
      To change the color mid-way, use \b and it will use the next color in your colors array.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to render to the screen.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      colors - The ordered list of colors to iterate through when using \b.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(FontFormat format, int x, int y, int color)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      Parameters:
      format - The format to form the text and colors.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      color - The color of the text.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(String text, int x, int y, int color, int... colors)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      In order to create a new line, use \n.
      In order to create a tabbed space, use \t.
      In order to create a short space (half the size of a normal NBSP), use \r.
      To change the color mid-way, use \b and it will use the next color in your colors array.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to render to the screen.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      color - The color of the text.
      colors - The ordered list of colors to iterate through when using \b.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(FontFormat format, int x, int y, int color, double spacing)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      Parameters:
      format - The format to form the text and colors.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      color - The color of the text.
      spacing - The spacing between each letter (default is 1).
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(String text, int x, int y, int color, double spacing, int... colors)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      In order to create a new line, use \n.
      In order to create a tabbed space, use \t.
      In order to create a short space (half the size of a normal NBSP), use \r.
      To change the color mid-way, use \b and it will use the next color in your colors array.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to render to the screen.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      color - The color of the text.
      spacing - The spacing between each letter (default is 1).
      colors - The ordered list of colors to iterate through when using \b.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(FontFormat format, int x, int y, int color, double spacing, double lineHeight)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      Parameters:
      format - The format to form the text and colors.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      color - The color of the text.
      spacing - The spacing between each letter (default is 1).
      lineHeight - The height between lines when using \n (default is 1).
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMore

      public FontOutput renderMore(String text, int x, int y, int color, double spacing, double lineHeight, int... colors)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      In order to create a new line, use \n.
      In order to create a tabbed space, use \t.
      In order to create a short space (half the size of a normal NBSP), use \r.
      To change the color mid-way, use \b and it will use the next color in your colors array.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to render to the screen.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      color - The color of the text.
      spacing - The spacing between each letter (default is 1).
      lineHeight - The height between lines when using \n (default is 1).
      colors - The ordered list of colors to iterate through when using \b.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

    • renderMoreWithLimits

      public final FontOutput renderMoreWithLimits(FontFormat format, int x, int y, Rectangle bounds)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      Parameters:
      format - The format to form the text and colors.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      bounds - The x, y, width, and height limitations on the screen to render the text to.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.

      public final FontOutput renderMoreWithLimits(String text, int x, int y, int color, double spacing, Rectangle bounds, int... colors)

    • renderMoreWithLimits

      public final FontOutput renderMoreWithLimits(String text, int x, int y, int color, double spacing, double lineHeight, Rectangle bounds, int... colors)
      Ease-of-access to continue rendering after rendering initial text.
      In order to create a new line, use \n.
      In order to create a tabbed space, use \t.
      In order to create a short space (half the size of a normal NBSP), use \r.
      To change the color mid-way, use \b and it will use the next color in your colors array.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to render to the screen.
      x - The x position to render on the screen.
      y - The y position to render on the screen.
      color - The color of the text.
      spacing - The spacing between each letter (default is 1).
      lineHeight - The height between lines when using \n (default is 1).
      bounds - The x, y, width, and height limitations on the screen to render the text to.
      colors - The ordered list of colors to iterate through when using \b.
      Returns:
      A FontOutput to find the locations of the text, the font family, and the font size.
